commitResults.messageBody:
Chat bot starts by greeting the user and echos user's inputs.
When user types, "bye" the bot exits and stops.

Chat Bot adds whatever text input to an ArrayList.
When User types "list", Chat Bot will display all the text the
user has entered in chronological order.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create Task class and includes done feature
commitResults.messageBody:
Task class has two attributes, String name and boolean done. markDone
sets done = True and getName gets name. An overriden string method
returns the object's name and a symbol to indicate if the Task has been
done or not done.

The main method now includes the command "done" to allow the user to
mark tasks that are done. E.g "done 1" will mark the first task done.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adds todo, deadline and event class
commitResults.messageBody:
Todo deadline and event class are subclasses of Task.
Todo class is for tasks with no date/time attached
Deadline class is for tasks with a data/time to indicate when the
dealine is.
Event class is for tasks with date/time to indicate when it starts and
when it ends.

Data/time are strings.

The main includes todo, deadline and event features. If user specifies
which type of task to do, the main will handle each type accordingly.
Adds automated testing files to the files.

If todo description is empty, user is prompted to include

If task type is not specified, the user is prompted that the bot does
not know what the user is trying to say.

Adds delete feature. If user specifies delete command, it will remove
the specified task (in terms of index ) from the task list.

Create DukeException and main throw DukeException when invalid command
or todo is missing a description.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add save feature and data file
commitResults.messageBody:
Chat Bot saves data file by parsing each task the follwing format
TaskType/isDone/Desc/Desc_1. Only for todo task, Desc_1 is ommited.

Using bufferedwriter to write the textfile Duke.txt because stream
flushes and closes regularly after each command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add date format to Deadline class
commitResults.messageBody:
Import LocalDate and DateTimeFormatter to convert string desc
to a LocalDate type.

Convert input "uuuu-MM-dd" to "LL dd uuuu" for deadline tasks.
Correctly parses the deadline time into data/duke.txt

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Ui, Storage, Parser and TaskList classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The List of classess is as follows:
1. Ui: Deals with interactions with user and manages System output

2. Storage: Deals with loading tasks from duke.txt and writing new
data to the file.

3. Parser: Deals with intepreting user inputs and returning the
parsing it as their respective tasks or modes. enum Modes is used to
differentiate between each command to tell the program what action
is required.

4. TaskList: Encapsulates the list of tasks as an Array List and
contains methods such as add/remove/markDone to modify the queue.

The Task.java file contains the task class and its subclasses.
DukeException file contains the DukeException class.

The main method in Duke.java only contains the logic of the program.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add packages, move classes to Duke folder
commitResults.messageBody:
Create Duke folder within java folder and move class files to Duke
folder. Import classess as packages in Duke.java.

Sepearte Task subclasses into their respective files
(e.g todo-> todo.java).

Minor grammar fix in printing total current task(s) as singular where
applicable.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit Tests, replace line seperator with \n
commitResults.messageBody:
Create JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code.
Add two JUnit Testcases under test folder to check the
system output format.

Replace System.lineSeperator with next line character "\n" so that it
is easier to test for system outputs on JUnit.
Test parser output using JUnit test.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add relative path references and create data file
commitResults.messageBody:
Path references to the data file are relative to the source file.

If the destination folder and duke.txt not initialised yet, Storage
will create the folder and text file when it is instantiated.

Remove data folder because Storage class creates it for the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc comments to most classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Brief description for just the public methods and classes.

Also fix import statements and some bugs.

Change indentation, whitespaces and variable names to comply with
coding standards.

Find will search for task names containing the specificed string and
return a list of matching tasks.

User input command "find <string>" will find the
tasks matching <string>

Add gradle feature to automate tests.

Add TaskListTest to test TaskList methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add GUI feature using JavaFX library
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Launcher class to launch proj using JavaFX.

Add DialogBox class to handle dialog boxes formattings

Resource folder contains images to be used for the GUI

Two changes to Duke class: Remove main method in Duke,
use launcher main instead to run bot.

Start method ininitialises files, storage and tasklist using method
init before proceeding

Add JavaFX dependencies into build.gradle

Assertion ensures task inputs have the correct number of arguments
E.g 3 arg for deadline, 2 for todo.

Remove excess png images.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move code into new packages, improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
Add new packages to categorise classes of the same cateogry to navigate
code easily. E.g Task Package contains TaskList, Task, Deadline and etc.

Add MainWindow class to represent the application window and abstract
the formatting and dialog Box creation.

Add Commandhandler to abstract away how the bot handles each command.
E.g Task commands need to be added to tasklist, stored while List
command only needs to return string output. Use public static method
execute to handle the user command.

Create a new file for enum class Mode, under command package.

Duke encapsulates the bot's current TaskList, Storage and exit status.

Use Main.main() to run bot. build.gradle and ReadME.md changes
accordingly

Able to tag Tasks when using the command tag.
e.g tag 1 favourite will tag the task favourite and be shown in the
list of tasks with a hashtag.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality and add JavaDocs
commitResults.messageBody:
Replace string concatencaction with StringBuilder and String.format.

Fix code indentation and whitespaces.

Add exceptions for invalid deadline input.

Magic package contains all the magic strings the bot needs.
MyString contains Error, symbols, string delimiters and UI responses.

Format contains the strings used for formatting by tasks and UI to
display the tasks to the user.

Fix some bugs.
Include new instructions to setup and sample screenshot
Add User Guide instructions in docs/README.md and sample photo.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix formatting of sample screen shot
